headerDisplay: For help and support please visit our GitHub Wiki. We hope you find this plugin useful!

countryCode.title: Country Code
countryCode.description: The telephone country code linked to your eWeLink account (without the +).

username.title: Username
username.description: The phone number or email address linked to your eWeLink account. If you use a phone number then enter the country code (with the +), for example +8613185260282.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password for your eWeLink account.

disableHTTPRefresh.title: Disable Initial Device Refresh
disableHTTPRefresh.description: If checked, devices will not be refreshed with their most recent status from eWeLink on startup. This setting can be useful for users who block their devices from accessing the internet.

disableLANMode.title: Disable LAN Mode
disableLANMode.description: If checked, all device updates will be sent straight to the cloud.

debug.title: Debug Logging
debug.description: If checked, debug information will be added to the log.

debugReqRes.title: Request & Response Logging
debugReqRes.description: If checked, HTTP, web socket and LAN mode messages will be added to the log. Not recommended for long-term use.

disablePlugin.title: Disable Plugin
disablePlugin.description: If checked, the plugin will remove all accessories and not load the plugin on restart.

hideDevFromHB.title: Hide Devices
hideDevFromHB.description: A list of devices to ignore. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

hideChanFromHB.title: Hide Light/Switch Channels
hideChanFromHB.description: A list of light/switch channels to hide. For example '10009553c8SW0' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8SW0,10009553c9SW2' (without the quotes).

outletAsSwitch.title: Outlet As Switch
outletAsSwitch.description: A list of outlet devices to show as switches. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

inUsePowerThreshold.title: Outlet 'In Use' Threshold
inUsePowerThreshold.description: HomeKit will set the 'In Use' status of outlet devices to true when the wattage is above this number.

hideLightFromFan.title: Hide Fan Lights
hideLightFromFan.description: A list of iFan devices for which the light will be hidden. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

hideSwitchFromTH.title: Hide TH10/16 Switches
hideSwitchFromTH.description: A list of TH10/TH16 devices for which the switch will be hidden. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

thAsThermostat.title: TH As Thermostat
thAsThermostat.description: A list of TH10/TH16 devices to show as thermostats. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

resetRFBridge.title: Reset RF Bridges
resetRFBridge.description: A list of RF Bridges to remove and re-add on restart. This is needed when adding/removed sub-devices from the RF Bridge. For example '10009553c8' or multiple separated with a comma '10009553c8,10009553c9' (without the quotes).

lowBattThreshold.title: Low Battery Threshold
lowBattThreshold.description: HomeKit will set the low battery status for supported devices when the device battery reaches this percentage level.

sensorTimeDifference.title: Sensor Lag
sensorTimeDifference.description: An offset in seconds to ignore any notifications if they is a delay between a sensor detecting something and the plugin receiving the notification. This setting applies to sensors connected to RF/Zigbee Bridges.

hideZBLDPress.title: Zigbee Button Hide Double/Long Press
hideZBLDPress.description: If checked, double and long press options will be hidden for the ZigBee button.

deviceId.title: Device ID
deviceId.description: Device ID from your eWeLink app (ten digits normally in the format 1000ab23cd).

type.title: Type
type.description: The new type for this device.

setup.title: Device Setup
setup.description: The setup for your garage doors.

oneOf.title: One Switch - for up and down
Two Switches - one for up and one for down

operationTime.title: Operation Time (Deciseconds)
operationTime.description: Blinds/garage doors: the time to open/close the device. Locks: the time to show as unlocked. This setting is in deciseconds - count the time in seconds and multiply by 10, for example 75 for 7.5 seconds.

sensorId.title: Sensor
sensorId.description: A DW2 sensor can be used for garage doors to determine the current state. Enter the 10 digit eWeLink device ID (normally in the format 1000ab23cd). Otherwise leave blank.

fullDeviceId.title: Sensor Device ID
fullDeviceId.description: Device ID of the sensor (13 digits normally in the format 1000ab23cdSW2).

type.title: Sensor Type
type.description: Select the type of sensor you would like to expose this as.

sensorTimeLength.title: Sensor Time Length
sensorTimeLength.description: The number of seconds which the sensor tile in the Home app will light up for if this sensor is activated.

layout.title: Device Specific Settings
layout.description: Further optional settings for specific devices.

layout.title: Accessory Simulations
layout.description: You can use this setting to set up custom simulated HomeKit accessories from a generic single/multi-switch device. Please see this wiki article for more information.

layout.title: RF Bridge Sensors
layout.description: You can expose different types of sensors connected to your RF Bridge. Please see this wiki article for more information.
